TopicTitle: Kerbal Stuff, an open-source Space Port replacement

Articles.Content:
Hey Sir, micro-issue: if a mod doesn't have a banner picture, maybe it would be cool to reduce the image area in the mod's page, because otherwise it looks *really* empty.

That's kind of by design. I want to encourage modders to upload banner images.
But I'm lazy! I see your point though. I just reported it, what to do with it is choice.

Love the redesign.

The edit mod description page doesn't have a link to your markdown examples, unlike your edit profile page which does.

Love the redesign.

The edit mod description page doesn't have a link to your markdown examples, unlike your edit profile page which does.

Thanks for the heads up.

Hi SirCmpwn

I'm new to KS - I like it - good layout and also you've created a good, although unconventional, user experiance for devs..

but there is a lot missing for a full grown community currently..

I'd like to contribute but I need to learn python and flask to do so..

can you give me a usefull link to do both in one?

Would be highly appreciated..

Hi SirCmpwn

I'm new to KS - I like it - good layout and also you've created a good, although unconventional, user experiance for devs..

but there is a lot missing for a full grown community currently..

I'd like to contribute but I need to learn python and flask to do so..

can you give me a usefull link to do both in one?

Would be highly appreciated..

I'm not here to help you learn Python, but a little bit of Googling will set you on the right path. Can you share some more tangible feedback on what you think is missing?

now I understand why you are working alone on this..

never mind..
philotical, you might be interested in checking this out.
GitHub repository moved to https://github.com/KerbalStuff/KerbalStuff.
News: SSL enabled sitewide with Majiir's help.
Awesome! It's also nice to know he's still around, give him a poke from all of us

Does someone know how to add an imgur album on mod description ?

Thanks.

[[https://imgur.com/blahblahblah]]

The markdown example listing isn't linked to on the mod edit page at the moment.

@TMS: great !! Thanks a lot .

This might be added to the TODO list I guess .
News: 1,000 users!
Yay! That's awesome

More news:

Mods can now have multiple authors. Each new author is shown on the mod page, and is allowed to edit the mod listing or update the mod.

Less interesting news:

  • Exporting stats now sets the file extension to .csv
  • Uploads show a progress bar now
  • Drag and drop works in the places it claims to
  • You can no longer publish mods without editing the default description
  • Update emails fixed to show new version's changelog properly

Thanks .

More news:

Less interesting news:

[*]Uploads show a progress bar now

This is very interesting, to me. A lot more better than looking at upload bandwidth in use (I use the small perfmon4).

EDIT: could it be possible to set up a dev website, as I see dependencies is quite a long list and I'm not use to set-up web server and website made with Python, it will make life easier for people who wants to add features or bug fixes. On the expense of make your life a bit less easier.

Edited September 7, 2014 by Justin Kerbice
add dev webite suggestion
What happens to all of the links when the beta ends? Do they get redirected to the main site?

What happens to all of the links when the beta ends? Do they get redirected to the main site?

Yes.

(padding to 10 characters)

Uploads show a progress bar now

Possibly the only thing about updating a mod I disliked, and you've fixed it.
really liking the simplified upload, and progress bar too! Thank you sir!

really liking the simplified upload, and progress bar too! Thank you sir!

Thanks for the kind words
Wow Only just found this and I'm loven it ! Cant wait to download and try some of the mods

Question. Curse has ads. Curse uses these ads to share some revenue with modders. It's for this reason that some mods like MechJeb won't be coming to Kerbal Stuff any time soon.

Is there any interest in letting modders optionally show ads on their mod listings and giving them 100% of the revenue from them?
